summary: U.S. Customs and Border Protection facilitates trade and travel at the nation’s 167 land border crossings. CBP and the General Services Administration own or lease these facilities. Many were built over 70 years ago and struggle to keep up with the usage demanded of them. We found that CBP doesn't have complete information on infrastructure conditions at these crossings. title: Border Infrastructure: Actions Needed to Improve Information on Facilities and Capital Planning at Land Border Crossings
